website_summaries.verdict: Trusted brand and product that many say works in a way no other does.
pros: Odorless and colorless gel that most say provides instant comfort
Unlike the Benadryl cream version and some other products on the market, this doesn't stain clothing or flake off
cons: A few think the bottle is too large
Some say the gel consistency is too watery

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since toilet paper!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this a million stars I would. It’s the one item in my house besides toilet paper I make sure we always have. Works great on bug bites for taking the itch away. On sunburns. I use it after waxing for taking away the redness and stinging. If you have hives it helps. It has real Benadryl in it so it really helps with inflammation. Love it X a million
customer_reviews.author: ang508

customer_reviews.title: Works well but be careful when applying
customer_reviews.text: When using this make sure the allergen is completely cleaned off of your skin. I did not, so when I applied this gel it spread around the allergen and made it worse.
customer_reviews.author: dasackis

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this would offer more relief than the hydrocortisone creams, but for me it actually does. I am severely sensitive to mosquito bites and I live in a cabin in the woods in a remote area, so having something that provides relief means a lot to me! Hooray for Benadryl Itch Relief Gel! I like that it's a gel, too and it really doesn't small much at all, which is nice, too!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L. Isbell

customer_reviews.title: Topical Benadryl reduces itch
customer_reviews.text: The addition of Benadryl to the gel makes it capable of reducing swelling and itch long term, but it doesn't have the same immediate affect as the children's Benadryl gel, which has menthol. It would be nice to have a single product with both Benadryl and menthol.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Ellett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent I’m dealing with a scalp allergy due to hair ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent I’m dealing with a scalp allergy due to hair color. This is the 1st day in 2 months I have not wanted to scratch my head off. I’ve spent around $200 on medicated shampoos, aloes, astringents, tea tree, eucalyptus, mint & coconut oil products. This is working. OMG.. now I can get back to healthy beautiful hair...
customer_reviews.author: Style Geek

customer_reviews.title: Only cure I have found.
customer_reviews.text: Mosquitoes love me and this is the only way I can live with myself after dealing with the little suckers.. Being a gel is great at it does not leave a oily residue on everything. If I could just find a way to keep the Mosquitoes away now...
customer_reviews.author: Customer X

customer_reviews.title: Fast, short-term relief
customer_reviews.text: Fast relief from itching. However, effects are short-lasting. Within a minute I was itchy again. But it does help decrease swelling. Great price i contacted my doctor and was told it is okay to use both this benadryl topical and the oral benadryl. just don't take it at the same exact time. oral benadryl effects last 4 hours, its side effect of drowsiness lasts longer than that. so it's fine to take an oral bendryl, and then apply this ointment 4 hours later without overdosing on benadryl.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Helps with Scaring!
customer_reviews.text: I am very sensitive to bug bites and they tend so get very swollen. I tried over the counter creams but they really didn’t help. The only thing that worked was a cream from Europe, that is not available in the US. I decided to give this a try in the hopes it will help relive my bug bites, and it sure helped. It’s a gel consistency and it gives a cooling effect. This helped a lot with getting rid of scaring as well. I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Princezana

customer_reviews.title: Bad product safety
customer_reviews.text: This is a tube of Benadryl gel and there was product on the outside of the tube because there was no safety seal around the outside of the cap nor under the cap. Quite a but of product leaked out because there was a sizable amount of liquid in the shipping envelope.
customer_reviews.author: P. Severance

customer_reviews.title: Not so Cool or Effective but OK.
customer_reviews.text: First of all it’s a weird gel that creates a layer in your screen, which in fact does a job to prevent from bugs, but doesn’t give enough relief to bytes. It is not strong enough and doesn’t last more than a couple of hours. And then you have to wash it because of that layer of skin which looks disgusting. It doesn’t work well on kids as well, maybe it’s not for kids but we gave it a try. Overall for a short term solution it will work. Also pouring out from the tube is messy, and you may have to apply multiple times throughout the day. In the end
customer_reviews.author: Atir Zubair

customer_reviews.title: Six weeks of itching from midge (no-see-um) bites from gardening ended TODAY!
customer_reviews.text: Tried icing the welts... nope. Tried vinegar to relieve intense itching... nope. Tried natural raw neem butter from India... nope. Tried this... omg, omg, omg, thank you, thank you, thank you. This is the best I've felt all summer and I can't thank you enough. I will never be without this product on my person again. And, BTW, if you are getting eaten alive and don't know what's biting you and you are gardening, it might be midges or no-see-ums. I never knew about 'em until this year and they literally suck as bad as mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: Wyborn Senna

customer_reviews.title: Does not work- watered down??
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work whatsoever on mosquito bites. I wonder too if it has been watered down and is fake like so many amazon products. It's not really a "gel" it's more like a liquid in a tube. Very strange. It vaguely works but not really. I just tossed it out. You know what works better is apple cider vinegar straight on your bug bite.
customer_reviews.author: DecoFleur

customer_reviews.title: Size description misleading!
customer_reviews.text: Be Aware! The description says (pack of two) and is 100% incorrect. You receive only one as I did. I’m not going to return a single small item because one was missing, as per description. If I would have known I would only receive one I could have ordered accordingly. The product is great, been using it for years. Also, in size description, you only have choices to order a (pack of two) or (pack of three), so I ordered a pack of two and got only one, be aware, so fix the description from being misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney D. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Helps with itching from spider bites
customer_reviews.text: Our couch has apparently become the home of some spiders. I took a few naps a week ago and ended up with half a dozen spider bites. I foolishly scratched them and they got worse. I tried triple-antibiotic cream and it helped a little. I searched Amazon and came across this affordable item. It’s a clear liquid, not a cream, but it cools down my leg and eases the itching. So far, I am happy with this. It’s not a 5-star solution, but 4 stars seems fair.
customer_reviews.author: Tucson Bluesman

customer_reviews.title: Its half empty.
customer_reviews.text: It was Not sealed. It just came. And spilled on the bag because it was not sealed. I needed this. But Its unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: Nay

customer_reviews.title: A good thing to keep handy in the summer-it works!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I had just been to our beach house and had gotten stung on my hand. It was very itchy and swollen. I applied aloe Vera with hydrocortisone cream. It helped but I am a diabetic and the next morning my blood sugar was higher than ever before. I thought this product sounded effective and safe for me. Yesterday the mosquitoes were out for a breakfast buffet As soon as I came back I applied this gel on my legs arms and neck. I rubbed it in well and the itching stopped within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Debby G

customer_reviews.title: Made my wife sick.
customer_reviews.text: My wife quickly became nauseous and nearly passed out. Washed it off and switched to Cortisone instead and the problems cleared up. My guess is you don't want to use this stuff on a very large skin area. It is way strong and has side effects.
customer_reviews.author: Dwarf Eight

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I react really badly to the smallest of bites. My bites generally last longer and get larger than they do on others so I’m always looking for relief. This product almost instantly cools my skin and the anti-itch lasts several hours. I recently misplaced it and resorted to using an anti-histamine cream and my itching was unbearable. I found this product again (it was right in front of my face too-how annoying is that?!?) and instant relief! I put it on my bites before bed and I didn’t itch all night (I had to reapply the anti-itch cream 1-2 times per night so huge difference!).
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my itching and scratching, better than cream version
customer_reviews.text: This really worked for me. After getting allergy shots weekly, I tend to itch & scratch constantly. This gel is better than the Benadryl cream in that it seems to work better. It is a liquid type gel that easily spreads over the skin and sinks in without any sticky residue. Once I put it on after my shower before bed, I only need to reapply the next evening. I’m very happy with this and will be reordering. Can’t beat the price for two 3.5-oz tubes! This would probably work for any itching you might have. Highly recommend over the cream version!
customer_reviews.author: SocalDancer

customer_reviews.title: So far the best short term relief I can find.
customer_reviews.text: They gave me this in the hospital for my swelling, itching rash/hives. So we paid much less online than at the store. It works for a moment but doesn’t last for my serious outbreaks. But I will always keep on hand. Can also store I refrigerator for extra cooling relief.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work Well
customer_reviews.text: I have recently been on the losing end of a battle with Mosquitos. My legs have about a dozen bites. I ordered this stuff because I like other Benadryl Products and it was a Gel. I can tell you this product does work, but only so well. The itching was calmed down to a mild roar and came back to full volume within a few hours. My experience with any type of Calamine product over the years, has been better than with this Benadryl Gel. I will not be buying this product again. Now to go and buy some Calamine.
customer_reviews.author: Bonapart

customer_reviews.title: Great Anti Itch Gel. (This Is Not A Topical Cream)
customer_reviews.text: This works good for any rashes or bug bites, etc. Please be aware this is a gel not a cream like some other topical anti itch treatments So it will dry out and feels a little weird once it’s dry. It works great to stop the itching and has a nice cooling affect, but it’s a little more messy then the cream and I feel anti itch cream works just a little better and lasts a little longer on the skin. So if your looking for more or an anti itch topical cream then get something more like a cortisone cream or Benadryl cream, or something comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Conor Colburn

customer_reviews.title: Effective for itchiness
customer_reviews.text: I have a burning hatred for mosquitoes. My legs and arms are covered with bites and scars from them. I can't stay in the house forever because I have to take my two dogs out for walk and playing in the backyard. Enters Benadryl itchy gel. I like that it's a thick gel so it remains on the bite and work its magic. It does stop the itchiness so I don't scratch myself bloody every time. However, this layer also remains behind after it became dry. It looks like peeling dry skin and I had to use a wash cloth to scrub it off since using my fingers weren't enough.
customer_reviews.author: Coconut

customer_reviews.title: Works but
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and it does help with the itching, however if you do accidentally touch your affected area after this product has dried, you will see residue after rubbing, and thin white layer of product coming off / almost looks like dry skin stuck to you. I used some on my eyelid at night and after waking up the next morning and seeing my face, the residue was highly noticeable. Being at home I don't care but If I ever applied this and went out in public or to work, I'd have to be mindful not to touch the area. Sometimes I can't help it and do it subconsciously.
customer_reviews.author: M P S

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Strangely enough I got this for my horse. She scratches her soldiers, taking off all the hair in the summer when flies are around. I tried everything human and equine 9to include all kinds of fly sprays chemical and natural) and none worked even though some supposedly had the same ingredients as Benadryl gel. The Benadryl gel worked almost instantly. Each day her hair grew back until now you can't even tell. i am not a great promoter of brand names but this gel is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzard Roost

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I have always been that person that gets a lot of bug bites during the summertime, and this has been a lifesaver. Put a little dab on bug bites and irritation goes away for hours allowing the skin to heal quickly.
customer_reviews.author: carrcrash

customer_reviews.title: The Best Anti Itch Gel
customer_reviews.text: I'm outdoors a lot and I would scratch bug and mosquito bites until they bled. Leaving my legs and arms a mess. BUT not anymore. This gel works pretty quickly when applied right away on a bite. With-in a few minutes, the initial itch and irritation stops and then keeps you from constantly scratching .
customer_reviews.author: techboy

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT my expectation of a gel, as like petroleum jelly. It is more similar to a liquid. When I first opened and about to apply, I squeezed the tube like I would with toothpaste, and a pile of liquid was all over my hand when I had actually expected a thick gel. It applies easily but sticky. I would not buy this product again and have returned back to buying the cream version that applies more easily.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Abrahamyan

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy this in the bottle but apparently people were taking it orally (Whaaaaaaat) so they had to put it in a tube. I liked it better in the bottle for travel but it still works. It takes the itch and irritation out of insect bites and stings and works well on poison ivy rashes.
customer_reviews.author: QQueequeg

customer_reviews.title: Itch stopping? NOPE.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what these reviewers are talking about. Absolutely did NOTHING to stop itching for me any more than applying water does. I have very sensitive skin and get contact dermatitis all the time. Cortisone gels you buy at the drugstore work better. Thanks for the refund, Amazon, bc the product does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Beckett Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Pack of 2 means just one tube.
customer_reviews.text: It is very thin clear liquid, not gel consistency, somewhat sticky. I have not used it yet. Received just one tube of 3.5 oz instead of a promised “pack of 2”. P.S. no relief from itch 10 min after I applied it to a fresh mosquito bite. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Elena M.

customer_reviews.title: Peeling off
customer_reviews.text: Just feel strange that I was using the kids one and don't have this problem. As you see from the picture, the gel was peeling off... After it is dry....
customer_reviews.author: Ebaby

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews how great this product is to stop itching from Mosquito bites. It is very runny and it does not stop itching. I haven't been able to sleep for two nights, rubbing this on quite a few times. It does not stop itching
customer_reviews.author: J. Trust

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fast relief!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My ankles were covered in little 'skeeter bites from being in a grassy area. The itching was unbearable (and the more you scratch the more it itches!) Put this light weight, non sticky gel on the bites and instant, lasting relief. It does not stain, it's not sticky, there's no scent, and once dry, you don't even know you have it on. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Outstander

customer_reviews.title: Works As Soon As It Dries!
customer_reviews.text: We keep a couple tubes of this around for our mosquito-filled Summers! One of my sons has a mosquito allergy and this works fast and effectively. Stops itching as soon as it dries. Great product! Also, just an FYI, Benadryl makes a “children’s” version of this that is also effective. We used that when the kids were toddlers, but now that they’re older, we give them “the real deal.” :-)
customer_reviews.author: SA1018

customer_reviews.title: stops itching
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for someone who has horrible allergies and is always itching . She keeps asking for more. She loves it because its topical and the pill makes her sleep, the topical is instant relief and its a gel so not messy
customer_reviews.author: debi

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your medicine cabinet
customer_reviews.text: This worked amazingly well for our kids after being eaten alive by bugs while camping. Most recently, my son had a very serious rash covering much of his lower body. He used this for relief while waiting on his appointment with Dr. Even after his appointment and being prescribed antibiotics and steroids. This cream gave more relief than both prescriptions together.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Richards

customer_reviews.title: This Stuff Works!  Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is without a doubt the absolute best at stopping the itch or sting from mosquito or bug bites. I'm allergic to any kind of bite and this helps to control swelling. My grandkids call it the "Gramma's itch cream", and always come to me to make an itchy bite better, even if the bite is a day old. Have used it for years after a friend had me try it.
customer_reviews.author: Decorator

customer_reviews.title: Wife approved!
customer_reviews.text: Has become our preferred product for mosquito bites & other random itches we encounter every day. My wife really loves it & says it works better than the other stuff we were using. I like the somewhat runny “gel” consistency rather than the “paste” texture of other products. Put it on & give it a minute to dry first.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend the liquid
customer_reviews.text: For poison oak itch, I'd recommend the spray on liquid. It was much better and relieving the terrible itching. Benadryl cream or pills were not as effective. Also, remember NOT to take pills if you are using either the spray or lotion.
customer_reviews.author: Randy G...

customer_reviews.title: Helps relieve itch but...
customer_reviews.text: Helps relieve itching but leaves a residue that is peel-able afterwards. Makes it look like you have dry skin.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Helps poison ivy itch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help the itch of poison ivy. Calamine lotion did nothing to help me and i was in so much pain from the itchiness. This is the only stuff that worked! Some people complained it peeled after drying. I only found that happened if i gobbed on too much. A thin layer is all you need. Hoping it comes back in stock so i can buy more to have on hand should i need it
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Instant relief
customer_reviews.text: I had a very bad reaction to the Unstoppables laundry beads and my legs wouldn't stop itching. I would wake up in the middle of the night scratching myself. Once I put this on my legs the itch went away. I had tried some many different creams and lotions and this was the only thing that helped. It dries quick even though it smells terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Dannay Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: amazing stuff
customer_reviews.text: my dad had some gnarly bites and im not sure what they were, maybe bed bugs or bugs from the gym. Anyways they were HORRIBLE and it was so painful to watch him suffer, he even got allergy tested at the doctors still not sure what got him so bad. anyways this benadryl and some high potency steroids really did the trick. gotta have both. bites were noticeably improved within days
customer_reviews.author: piggiesmalls

customer_reviews.title: Not as effective
customer_reviews.text: Its summertime and I've been getting bitten by mosquitos needed some itch relief and purchased this hoping that it would help. Unfortunately it wasnt as helpful. I noticed I still had itchy senstions. I tried waiting it out but I think I could have done that without the cream. Maybe find something else.
customer_reviews.author: CRS

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever for bug bites!
customer_reviews.text: this worked both for my bug bites and my poison Ivy. only draw back is it only lasts so long, since it goes on like a thin skin as it dries, it peels off and could look quite unsightly, like peeling skin after a few hours. I don't understand the "warmth" rating, so i left it blank...there is no heat with this...
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I keep repurchasing this because it works.
customer_reviews.text: My legs and stomach itch after wearing compression hose and a back brace for long, busy 12-hour shifts. This works to prevent the itch if I use it before work, or take it away if I don't use it before. My husband uses it if he gets a tick bite or chigger bites. It works for those as well. There is no odor, either.
customer_reviews.author: ann h.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many people I’m with, I’m the one who gets destroyed by mosquito bites. Usually the next day the bites look like welts. I finally did something about it and bought this product. It was inexpensive and had great reviews, so I ordered 2. Now I’m mad at myself for not ordering it sooner. Already had a bite yesterday. Used the product today. No itch and no welt. If you are prone to bug bites, buy this!
customer_reviews.author: CARMEN DIFABIO

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It works for a bit. It works long enough for my kids to forget they have a bug bite for awhile, but after an hour or two the kids let me know it still itches. (Probably from sweating or playing with water) Which is to be expected. So it's not a fix, but it lasts long enough so the bite doesn't annoy you for hours on end.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: My mosquito bite go to. We live in the woods and even with treatments from the exterminator we can’t fully avoid mosquitoes. I used to lie awake at night scratching the fire out of my bites. This product is cheap and a little goes a long way in providing quick relief for those itchy bites.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Its not as strong as I'd like, but it does help the itching and that's all that matters. I just liked the menthol feel that Rhuli gel used to have, and i guess they dont make that anymore, so this will do ..
customer_reviews.author: HoneyBeeGracious

customer_reviews.title: Not good packaging, be wary
customer_reviews.text: Product was as expected, but the actual packaging and delivery was not. The cap was not on tight enough and the item was simply tossed in an envelope so there was gel that leaked out everywhere. I had to watch off the container and lost some obviously. You can see the pic, it even leaked out to the seem in the envelope.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Size: 3.5 Fl Oz (Pack of 2) | Style: Extra Strength RECEIVED ONE TUBE!
customer_reviews.text: ADVERTISEMENT FOR TWO TUBES~ I ONLY RECEIVED ONE TUBE! DIsHONEST Listing~ SEND SECOND TUBE YOU FEATURE & CONTINUE TO ADVERTISE IN LISTING. PLEASE READ THIS CAREFULLY. THIS IS A COOLING GET, YET REVIEW SAYS TO RATE IT FOR WARMTH? VERY STRANGE....
customer_reviews.author: Kokonana

customer_reviews.title: Best bug bite relief!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of bug bite itch relief products and this is by far the best. Takes the itch out almost immediately! Does smell a bit like Bengay, though.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for taking care of the itch - when you put it on right after you get bit
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it's so effective when you put it on as soon as you notice you've been bit by mosquitos. It has a slight cooling sensation and you wouldn't think that it would work but then I notice later I'm no longer itchy! It's saved my skin from me tearing it apart in the summer from itch.
customer_reviews.author: HLFEMME

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the 1 star reviews it gets..
customer_reviews.text: This product is awful..does absolutely nothing to stop itching..what ever happened to Benedryl? It used to work almost immediately. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: AtomicPunk

customer_reviews.title: Itch relief
customer_reviews.text: Really calms the itching, who needs to scratch all day right? You will need this for those nasty insect bites.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Benadryl Gel Very Effective - gets rid of rash
customer_reviews.text: These works really well for prickly heat that I sometimes get - it stops the itching and clears up the prickly heat - it’s priced right too - and I really like that this is a gel and not a cream - it just seems like the gel works for me and not the cream. Definitely will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Soozie

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t stop the itch completely but good enough to stop me from scratching
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a lot of after bite creams and ointments and this one is pretty good. I can tell it’s working because it takes only 3mins to significantly lesson the itch. The itching is still there, but it is way more manageable and easier to ignore. It really does relieve the annoyances of mosquito bites. So glad I found something that helps me not to scratch my bug bites forever.
customer_reviews.author: nliu

customer_reviews.title: It works instantly
customer_reviews.text: Instant itch relief works right away i used many other brands and this one is by far the best just wish it stop all day but it only works for a bit then itch is back other then that I still love this one more then any others I have tried!
customer_reviews.author: Msk4

customer_reviews.title: No Protective Covering on Benadryl Tube
customer_reviews.text: The Benadryl tube came without any protective cover on the opening of the tube. I find this to be rather odd. Even when you buy a tube of toothpaste, you have to take off a little piece of foil off the opening of the tube before you can use any toothpaste. With this tube of Benadryl, I flipped the lid and the gel squirted out. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product.. only downside from a kid’s point of view was a bit sticky while drying, only a couple waves of the arm. Other than that, awesome! I like that it’s not a cream you have to sit there rubbing in for what feels like days at a time sometimes. Soaks into skin very quickly, easy to tote around with you on your adventures!
customer_reviews.author: CiCi M

customer_reviews.title: Works great on mosquito bites
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a mosquito magnet and gets welts from their bites. She will scratch a hole in her skin from the itching. This calms the itching almost immediately and is a great relief for her. Cortisone cremes don't work for her.
customer_reviews.author: rosterga@bigfoot.com

customer_reviews.title: This really works
customer_reviews.text: I used this gel on a very itchy rash caused by a bandage allergy. Cortisone ointment didn't touch the itch, but within minutes of applying this gel, the itching stopped. After a few days of daily application, the rash is gone.
customer_reviews.author: tvwatcher

customer_reviews.title: Also help with sunburn
customer_reviews.text: I brought this purposely for mosquito bite for my vacation to Vietnam last month. But then end up using it for sun burn because we all got sun burn from the beach. It really relaxing when you applied it onto your skin and helps with sun burn. One thing to keep in mind, the next day applied it will have some sort of skin peeling but it just the extract of the product. Its not only help with sun burn but also help with mosquito bites. Thanks god we had this on our vacation.
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: MUCH RELIEF !
customer_reviews.text: I got bitten 3 different times by tiny spiders that had invaded my car, and this was the ONLY treatment that gave me relief from the intense itching.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great anti-itch product
customer_reviews.text: This product really works well for itching. Knocks it out on contact. Mosquito bites and all sorts of rashes. Dries clear without an odor or stickiness. Great product for kids and adults. Doesn't sting going on either.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Limehouse

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STUFF
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great. Cools and calms the itch of insect bites super fast; not quite instantly, but pretty darn close. Only issue is that the description is very misleading; says "3.5 Fl Oz (Pack of 2)", but it is only a single unit.
customer_reviews.author: igogolf9

customer_reviews.title: It's Benadryl....
customer_reviews.text: I got this to see if it helped with my skeeter bites and poison ivy (after I washed). It didn't help any more than the regular Benadryl on the skeeter bites and I found something natural that did the job on poison ivy.
customer_reviews.author: NC Lady

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived unsealed and appears to be a very watery substance. I personally found it to be ineffective with my itching and was disappointed when I realized that it doesn’t not actually contain Benadryl but instead contains camphor (which heads up, is actually unsafe for children and breastfeeding women.) I will be returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas N

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: This is the fastest and most effective remedy for an itchy bug bite. I have severe reactions to insect bites and this not only stops the itch immediately but also keeps it from itching for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix Rising Cosplay

customer_reviews.title: A hive life-saver
customer_reviews.text: I love this gel! I get bad hives and had been taking Benadryl orally but hated the affects of that, this gel allows me to just put some on topically without having the side affects of the pills! No more tiredness! And it works great! I carry it with me everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Mine leaked!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was really upset that half of the bottle leaked. The top wasn’t pressed down securely
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Works in seconds
customer_reviews.text: Relieves an itch in seconds! It’s dries clear but if you apply too much it kind of looks like what elmers glue looks like dried. It worked almost instantly which was nice and the gel just makes it smoother going on and feels less messy.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great for bug bites
customer_reviews.text: I get mosquito bites quite a bit and also am allergic to a few things and have hives pop up. This definitely works AMAZING for mosquito/ant bites but not so much for my hives as some other reviews mentioned. Within a minute of my mosquito bite, it hasn’t been itchy since and I have not had to reapply.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Non-effective dull gel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after reading many good reviews. Unfortunately, it turned out to be absolutely waste of money for me. I tried it several times, but I was frustrated and puzzled with this non-effective product each time. I went back to Gold Bond anti-itch cream which I have been happily using for years.
customer_reviews.author: Zyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Relief
customer_reviews.text: I am allergic to mosquito bites and have spent plenty of time in the hospital for it, this provides great relief. Also, where I live the gnats are really bad so far this summer and this has been helping a lot for them!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing was working to relieve the sting and itch of bug bites on my kids. Mosquitos have been more vicious than normal this year. This gel handled it almost instantly. No more itching or stinging and the swelling went down within a few minutes. I'm so thankful for this product !
customer_reviews.author: Kaden

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as well as Benadryl cream
customer_reviews.text: Since it’s a gel it stays sticky for awhile. I prefer the traditional Benadryl cream for consistency and it helps itching more than this gel. Would use in an emergency but probably won’t buy again
customer_reviews.author: Haleigh

customer_reviews.title: Good brand name
customer_reviews.text: I have NO IDEA how well this works as I LOST IT right after opening it! LOL DUH is me! I trust Benadryl which is why I chose this one and can only assume it works as it’s supposed to. Will let ya know when I get another one !!
customer_reviews.author: DesertDweller

customer_reviews.title: Good relief
customer_reviews.text: Works well in terms of relief. Slight tingling feeling when used. Primarily used for mosquito bites for my girlfriend as she tends to react poorly to them. Works well, but it does leave a slight residue on the skin that eventually rubs off after it dries completely.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for chigger bites!
customer_reviews.text: Soothing for mild itchy stings like mosquitos, but not for the heavy duty bites of chiggers. But I can't think of any bug bite relief that would take down a chigger bite! I will probably look for something stronger next time but it's ok. Luckily I don't often encounter chiggers!!
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Medicine Cabinet Staple
customer_reviews.text: Works very well to stop the itch immediately. Glad I have this and I recommend it to everyone who lives around poison oak or has mosquitoes! I’ve never seen this in stores, so it’s a great find on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Daniella

customer_reviews.title: Woah talk about RELIEF
customer_reviews.text: Thank the lord for this because I’m the type of person to scratch my mosquito bites until they bleed. It’s really bad but this is the ONLY think that actually relieved the itch. Living in CA, you always get bit by mosquitos. This is for sure a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes this works
customer_reviews.text: Oh yeah this is the stuff. Finally something that stops the itch. Hint. Keep it in the refrigerator. It is such a cool relief. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cooling relief but had to reapply often!
customer_reviews.text: Not bad itching cream. Actually gives a cooling feeling which really helps relieve the itchiness but does not last long. Had to put the ointment quite often to feel the relief from it. Overall not so bad!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great Take Away Itch Relief Gel
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great! Really does take the itch away, the scent reminds me of bactine smell - not sure if you have smelled that before but that's the best way to describe it. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Weston & Lacey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not a pack of 2
customer_reviews.text: Descriptive information says "Size: 3.5 Fl Oz (Pack of 2)." I received one 3.4 oz. tube. The product is very watery, not what I would call a gel. I thought the price seemed too good.
customer_reviews.author: Broke in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect description.
customer_reviews.text: Incorrect description. I ordered a 2 pack of 3.5 oz bottle. I only received one bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie

customer_reviews.title: This product didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I always get eaten up by mosquitos so I decided to try this to relieve the itch. It didn’t work for me. I got no relief and the formula is super watery. Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Not a gel
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just got a bad tube, but even on the tube is reads "Gel." It is not a gel at ll, just a clear liquid and too messy. Helps a little for a short time. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Dr. Had me get this
customer_reviews.text: I was allergic to every stinging insect except honey bees. I had to get venom shots every month and the doctor told me to put this on each arm where I was given the shot. It really helped with the irritation.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K. Mcknight

customer_reviews.title: Gel spreads great
customer_reviews.text: I usually get the cream for my allergy shots, but tried this and it works so much better. I can cover a larger space on my arm when I itch to death after shots. It could be a tad thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Loo

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me
customer_reviews.text: This product worked for me for contact dermatitis . It took the itchy burning stinging away for a good few hours. It took me several days to clear it up (on arms).This was for the gel form.
customer_reviews.author: LadyT

customer_reviews.title: Johnson&Johnson provides NO tamper resistant protection on this product
customer_reviews.text: 1) I called J&J who confirmed there is no tamper resistant protection on this product. Hellooooo? Progress????? 2) there is also methylparaben and propylparaben as ingredients, not good
customer_reviews.author: janedo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all. Bought this as a replacement for the Benadryl spray that worked very well. This I keep reapplying all day long because it seems to do nothing at all to stop itching of normal bug bites. Had to replace it with something else
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Itch be gone!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, this is the only product I have found that has helped reduce the irritation and itch I feel from mosquito bites. I always have allergic reactions to mosquito bites so my bites swell up to the size of a baseball sometimes and this is the only thing that has gotten me through some rough itchy times. Definitely give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool!
customer_reviews.text: liked the product and it does work to stop the itching. very faint odor and dissipates quickly. very cool - think it will feel better this summer. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CLawson

customer_reviews.title: Great for mosquito bites !
customer_reviews.text: Had like over 20 mosquito bites from a trip to the tropics. My bites usually swell up and can last over a week itching and painful. I carried this with me at all times and whenever I discovered a new bite I put a bit of this gel on and instant relief!! The relief lasted a couple of hours for me and then I just reapplied. My bites didn’t even swell up! This did dry out my skin though, but most likely because I was applying some 4-5 times a day. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Best itch relief I've found!
customer_reviews.text: I have sensitive skin and I'm constantly battling allergic reactions. This takes on everything from bug bites to eczema and poison ivy. Goes on clear (not pink). My go to!
customer_reviews.author: Special K

product_meta.title: Benadryl Extra Strength Cooling Relief Anti-Itch Gel, Diphenhydramine HCI, 3.5 fl. oz
product_meta.description: Size:3.5 Fl Oz (Pack of 1)| Style:Extra StrengthBenadryl Extra-Strength Itch Stopping Gel provides fast & cooling relief from pain and itching. Made with 2% diphenhydramine HCI topical analgesic, this anti-itch and pain relief gel blocks the histamine that causes itching associated with insect bites, sunburn, scrapes, minor skin irritations, burns, and cuts. It also provides itch and pain relief associated with rashes due to poison ivy, poison oak, and poison sumac. This soothing topical gel is intended for ages two and up and is great to keep on hand during outdoor activities such as camping, hiking or taking a walk with the family.
feature_bullets: 3.5-ounce tube of Benadryl Extra-Strength Cooling Itch Stopping Anti-Itch Gel for fast cooling relief from skin pain and itching from most outdoor itches
Provides relief from most outdoor itches associated with insect bites, sunburn, scrapes, minor skin irritations, burns, and minor cuts
Soothing anti-itch gel also provides relief from itching associated with rashes caused by poison ivy, poison oak, and poison sumac
Cooling gel formula contains 2% of the topical analgesic pain reliever diphenhydramine hydrochloride that works by blocking histamines to relieve itches associated with several ailments

Intended for use by those ages 2 and up, soothing gel offers itch relief for kids and adults alike and is great to keep on hand during outdoor activities such as camping, hiking or taking a walk with the family

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
